Welcome to RI-Indexer’s documentation!¶

Submodules¶

Index Creator Script¶

CreateIndex.main(args)¶

Main script for Project 1. This script is responsable for calling the correct classes and for creating the data flow necessary for the index to be created and persisted.

Parameters

args (list<str>) – receives the arguments passed to the program during execution

File Parser Module¶

class FileParser.FileParser(files, limit)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class that serves as template and interface for future instances and implementations.

Parameters

  • files – list of file names to be processed

  • limit (int) – limit number of documents to have in consideration, None if no limit

abstract getContent()¶

Function that processes the files passed to the object during it’s creation.

class FileParser.GZipFileParser(files, limit)¶

Bases: FileParser.FileParser

Implementation of a file parser dedicated to the current context of RI. Processing of one or varios zip files.

getContent()¶

Implementation of the function defined by the abstract class. Fetches the PMID and the TI.

Returns

dictionary where the key is the PMID of the document and the value the TI

Return type

map<int, str>

Index Analyzer Auxiliar Script¶

IndexAnalyzer.buildDict(outputFileName)¶

Reads index output file and builds dictionary with terms as keys and number of occurrences as values

Param

outputFileName: name of the file to be processed

IndexAnalyzer.filterByOccur(n)¶

Finds the subset of the dictionary where the values are equal to value passed to the function.

Param

n: value that the user wants to find

Returns

subset of the dictionary that contains the value passed

Return type

map<str, int>

IndexAnalyzer.main(args)¶

Function that answerers to some of the assignment’s questions. Function that creates the data flow for the auxiliar script.

Param

args: the list of arguments passed to the script when executed

IndexAnalyzer.partition(terms, low, high)¶

Auxiliary method for the quicksort algorithm. Acts as a partitioner of the terms and when doing so, also sorts them.

Param

terms: list of terms to be sorted

Param

low: minimum index that the algorithm must consider

Param

hight: maximum index that the algorithm must consider

Returns

the index where the list should be partitioned

Return type

int

IndexAnalyzer.quicksortAlphabetical(terms, low, high)¶

Quicksort algorithm implementation that orders the passed terms alphabetically.

Param

terms: list of terms to be sorted

Param

low: minimum index that the algorithm must consider

Param

hight: maximum index that the algorithm must consider

Indexer Module¶

class Indexer.FileIndexer(fileParser, tokenizer)¶

Bases: Indexer.Indexer

Implementation of a indexer dedicated to the current context of RI.

createIndex()¶

Implementation of the function defined by the abstract class. Creates the index and returns it.

Returns

dictionary where the key is the token and the value is a dictionary were the key is the docId and the value the number of occurences of that token in that document, i.e., the index

Return type

map<str, map<int, str>>

class Indexer.Indexer(fileParser, tokenizer)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class and interface for several types of index persistances implementations.

Parameters

  • fileParser (FileParser) – instance of the file parser used in the context to retrieve the data from the corpus

  • tokenizer (Tokenizer) – instance of the tokenizer used in the context to process the content of the corpus

abstract createIndex()¶

Function that creates the entire index by iterating over the corpus content and with the help of the tokenizer process and create the token index

Index Persistance Module¶

class PersistIndex.PersistCSV(filename, indexer)¶

Bases: PersistIndex.PersistIndex

Implementation of the index persister dedicated to the current context of RI. This instance persists the index in a text file, following a csv-like format, such as:

token1,docID1:numOcur,docID2:numOcur,… token2,docID1:numOcur,docID2:numOcur,…

persist()¶

Function that effectively persists the data.

class PersistIndex.PersistIndex(filename, indexer)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class and interface for several types of index persistance implementations, due to file format or processing method

Parameters

  • filename (str) – name of the file were the information should be written too

  • indexer (Indexer) – instance of the indexer used in the context to create the corpus index

abstract persist()¶

Function that effectively persists the data.

Tokenizer Module¶

class Tokenizer.ComplexTokenizer¶

Bases: Tokenizer.Tokenizer

Implementation of a tokenizer dedicated to the current context of RI. This instance is the complex implementation porposed in 2.2. This version uses the PorterStemmer, eliminates stop words and implements some personal rules in relation to special characters(split by [ -_], keeps dates, emails, money, digits, … ; eliminates majority of the punctuantion)

tokenize(processText)¶

Function that receives a string and tokenizes it, applying as many rules as implemented by the user.

Parameters

processText (str) – text that will be tokenized

class Tokenizer.SimpleTokenizer¶

Bases: Tokenizer.Tokenizer

Implementation of a tokenizer dedicated to the current context of RI. This instance is the simple implementation porposed in 2.1, spliting by ” ” and eliminating all non-alphabetic characters.

tokenize(processText)¶

Function that receives a string and tokenizes it, applying as many rules as implemented by the user.

Parameters

processText (str) – text that will be tokenized

class Tokenizer.Tokenizer¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class and interface for the various possible implementations of tokenizers

abstract tokenize(porcessText)¶

Function that receives a string and tokenizes it, applying as many rules as implemented by the user.

Parameters

processText (str) – text that will be tokenized
